<title level="1" right="Focus 4" pfs="Standard">[Bottle the Storm](/Spells.aspx?ID=609)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Electricity" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=56" />
<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Gods & Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=17) pg. 115 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Domain**
[Lightning](/Domains.aspx?ID=47)

<row gap="medium">

<row gap="tiny">
<row>**Cast**</row>
<row><actions string="Reaction" /></row>
<row>[somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283)</row>
</row>

**Trigger** You would take electricity damage.

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

When lightning is turned at you, you store the charge safely within yourself, unleashing it when the time is right. You gain electricity resistance 10 against the triggering effect. If you successfully prevent damage in this way, at any time during the spell’s duration, you can spend a single action, which has the [attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=15) trait, to expend the charge and make a melee spell attack at an adjacent target or a ranged spell attack at a target within 60 feet. This attack deals electricity damage equal to the damage prevented by _bottle the storm_. If you cast _bottle the storm_ a second time before the original duration elapses, or if you do not make this attack, the stored charge dissipates harmlessly.

---
**Heightened (7th)** The resistance increases to 15, and you can immediately make the spell attack roll granted by _bottle the storm_ as part of the reaction used to cast the spell.

**Heightened (10th)** The resistance increases to 20, and you can immediately make the spell attack roll granted by _bottle the storm_ as part of the reaction used to cast the spell.
name: Bottle the Storm
